messages.content: ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData is a custom node for ComfyUI that adds a node to save images with metadata (PNGInfo) extracted from the input values of each node.

To install ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData, you need to clone the repository from GitHub into the custom_nodes directory of the ComfyUI installation by running the command: 'git clone https://github.com/nkchocoai/ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData.git'.
What does the Save Image With Metadata node do?
The Save Image With Metadata node saves the 'images' received as input as an image with metadata (PNGInfo).
What is the purpose of the 'filename_prefix' parameter?

The 'filename_prefix' parameter in ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData is used to replace specified parts of a string with information such as seed value, image size, prompts, model name, or date. This allows for dynamic naming of the saved image files based on the information passed from previous nodes.
What options are available for 'sampler_selection_method' in the Save Image With Metadata node?

'sampler_selection_method' offers three options: 'Farthest' (selects the farthest KSampler node), 'Nearest' (selects the nearest KSampler node), and 'By node ID' (selects a KSampler node by its node ID).
What metadata is included when saving an image with ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData?

The metadata included when saving an image with ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData includes positive prompt, negative prompt, steps, sampler, CFG Scale, seed, clip skip, size, model, model hash, VAE, VAE hash, Loras, embeddings, and batch index and size for batches with 2 or more images.
How can I determine which nodes and extensions are supported by ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData?
To determine which nodes and extensions are supported by ComfyUI-SaveImageWithMetaData, refer to the 'py/defs/captures.py' and 'py/defs/samplers.py' files, as well as the 'py/defs/ext/' directory.
